intro: Seseli staintonii, commonly known as Stainton's Seseli, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in the Mediterranean, particularly in southern Europe and western Asia. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
